awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Selection Criteria and Metastable    States for Phase Transitions in Fluids and Solids
awd_abstract_narration: This research program is concerned with two related                        projects.  One is the selection of equilibrium states of                        a three dimensional, nonlinearly elastic body undergoing                        a phase transformation.  The selection criterion involves                       a singular perturbation problem for a nonconvex functional                      in a variational formulation.  The second is the study of                       the long time behavior of the solutions of the Cahn-Hilliard                    equation which models the phase-separation of binary alloys                     and polymer mixtures that have been rapidly cooled.                                  The results from these two projects are expected to                        have significant impact on engineering mechanics.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
